clinical_study.brief_title: Comparative Performance of Dynamic Elastic Response Feet
clinical_study.official_title: Comparative Performance of Dynamic Elastic Response Feet

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the functional performance of individuals with transtibial amputation using two types of prosthetic foot designs: carbon fiber vs. fiberglass composite.

detailed_description.textblock: Recently, a new type of prosthetic foot has appeared on the market. This device is composed of a fiberglass composite material. Knowledge is lacking regarding the performance characteristics of this new device. Comprehensive studies are needed to form a solid basis for prosthetic prescription. The current study seeks to understand the experience of community-living, transtibial amputees using this prosthetic foot. Specifically, the biomechanical performance of this device will be compared to existing conventional DER technology in a controlled laboratory setting. The investigators hypothesize that the fiberglass composite material will provide more energy return and improved ankle kinematics performance.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, one month after switching to other foot.
primary_outcome.description: Difference in gait function assessed via whole body kinematics/kinetics and foot specific characteristics (energy storage and return, rollover shape, and stiffness).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, one month after switching to other foot
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will fill out the Prosthesis Evaluation Questionnaire (PEQ) survey

arm_group.description: All participants to be studied on their current carbon fiber foot as well as the study provided fiberglass composite foot.

intervention.description: The intervention is a glass based composite.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Unilateral transtibial amputee
- Currently using a carbon fiber prosthetic (DER) foot for at least the last 6 months
- Stable stump volume over the past 6 months
- Medicare Functional Classification Level K3 or K4
Exclusion Criteria:
- Neuromuscular problems such as previous stroke or contralateral amputation
- Use of gait aids for ambulation
- Undergoing dialysis
- Poor prosthetic socket fit or stump problems (e.g., skin breakdown)
